segment.source: Use a RichTextBlock with RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create advanced text layouts.
segment.target: Use a RichTextBlock with RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create advanced text layouts.

segment.source: RichTextBlock
segment.target: RichTextBlock

segment.source: Rich text block
segment.target: Rich text block

segment.source: Rich text blocks provide several features for advanced text layout that you can use when you need support for paragraphs, inline UI elements, or complex text layouts.
segment.target: Rich text blocks provide several features for advanced text layout that you can use when you need support for paragraphs, inline UI elements, or complex text layouts.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: RichTextBlock class
segment.target: RichTextBlock class

segment.source: RichTextBlockOverflow class
segment.target: RichTextBlockOverflow class

segment.source: Paragraph class
segment.target: Paragraph class

segment.source: Typography class
segment.target: Typography class

segment.source: Is this the right control?
segment.target: Is this the right control?

segment.source: Use a RichTextBlock when you need support for multiple paragraphs, multi-column or other complex text layouts, or inline UI elements like images.
segment.target: Use a RichTextBlock when you need support for multiple paragraphs, multi-column or other complex text layouts, or inline UI elements like images.

segment.source: Use a TextBlock to display most read-only text in your app.
segment.target: Use a TextBlock to display most read-only text in your app.

segment.source: You can use it to display single-line or multi-line text, inline hyperlinks, and text with formatting like bold, italic, or underlined.
segment.target: You can use it to display single-line or multi-line text, inline hyperlinks, and text with formatting like bold, italic, or underlined.

segment.source: TextBlock provides a simpler content model, so it’s typically easier to use, and it can provide better text rendering performance than RichTextBlock.
segment.target: TextBlock provides a simpler content model, so it’s typically easier to use, and it can provide better text rendering performance than RichTextBlock.

segment.source: It's preferred for most app UI text.
segment.target: It's preferred for most app UI text.

segment.source: Although you can put line breaks in the text, TextBlock is designed to display a single paragraph and doesn’t support text indentation.
segment.target: Although you can put line breaks in the text, TextBlock is designed to display a single paragraph and doesn’t support text indentation.

segment.source: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the Text controls article.
segment.target: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the Text controls article.

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: Create a rich text block
segment.target: Create a rich text block

segment.source: The content property of RichTextBlock is the Blocks property, which supports paragraph based text via the Paragraph element.
segment.target: The content property of RichTextBlock is the Blocks property, which supports paragraph based text via the Paragraph element.

segment.source: It doesn't have a Text property that you can use to easily access the control's text content in your app.
segment.target: It doesn't have a Text property that you can use to easily access the control's text content in your app.

segment.source: However, RichTextBlock provides several unique features that TextBlock doesn’t provide.
segment.target: However, RichTextBlock provides several unique features that TextBlock doesn’t provide.

segment.source: RichTextBlock supports:
segment.target: RichTextBlock supports:

segment.source: Multiple paragraphs.
segment.target: Multiple paragraphs.

segment.source: Set the indentation for paragraphs by setting the TextIndent property.
segment.target: Set the indentation for paragraphs by setting the TextIndent property.

segment.source: Inline UI elements.
segment.target: Inline UI elements.

segment.source: Use an InlineUIContainer to display UI elements, such as images, inline with your text.
segment.target: Use an InlineUIContainer to display UI elements, such as images, inline with your text.

segment.source: Overflow containers.
segment.target: Overflow containers.

segment.source: Use RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create multi-column text layouts.
segment.target: Use RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create multi-column text layouts.

segment.source: Paragraphs
segment.target: Paragraphs

segment.source: You use Paragraph elements to define the blocks of text to display within a RichTextBlock control.
segment.target: You use Paragraph elements to define the blocks of text to display within a RichTextBlock control.

segment.source: Every RichTextBlock should include at least one Paragraph.
segment.target: Every RichTextBlock should include at least one Paragraph.

segment.source: You can set the indent amount for all paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the RichTextBlock.TextIndent property.
segment.target: You can set the indent amount for all paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the RichTextBlock.TextIndent property.

segment.source: You can override this setting for specific paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the Paragraph.TextIndent property to a different value.
segment.target: You can override this setting for specific paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the Paragraph.TextIndent property to a different value.

segment.source: Inline UI elements
segment.target: Inline UI elements

segment.source: The InlineUIContainer class lets you embed any UIElement inline with your text.
segment.target: The InlineUIContainer class lets you embed any UIElement inline with your text.

segment.source: A common scenario is to place an Image inline with your text, but you can also use interactive elements, like a Button or CheckBox.
segment.target: A common scenario is to place an Image inline with your text, but you can also use interactive elements, like a Button or CheckBox.

segment.source: If you want to embed more than one element inline in the same position, consider using a panel as the single InlineUIContainer child, and then place the multiple elements within that panel.
segment.target: If you want to embed more than one element inline in the same position, consider using a panel as the single InlineUIContainer child, and then place the multiple elements within that panel.

segment.source: This example shows how to use an InlineUIContainer to insert an image into a RichTextBlock.
segment.target: This example shows how to use an InlineUIContainer to insert an image into a RichTextBlock.

segment.source: Overflow containers
segment.target: Overflow containers

segment.source: You can use a RichTextBlock with RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create multi-column or other advanced page layouts.
segment.target: You can use a RichTextBlock with RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create multi-column or other advanced page layouts.

segment.source: The content for a RichTextBlockOverflow element always comes from a RichTextBlock element.
segment.target: The content for a RichTextBlockOverflow element always comes from a RichTextBlock element.

segment.source: You link RichTextBlockOverflow elements by setting them as the OverflowContentTarget of a RichTextBlock or another RichTextBlockOverflow.
segment.target: You link RichTextBlockOverflow elements by setting them as the OverflowContentTarget of a RichTextBlock or another RichTextBlockOverflow.

segment.source: Here's a simple example that creates a two column layout.
segment.target: Here's a simple example that creates a two column layout.

segment.source: See the Examples section for a more complex example.
segment.target: See the Examples section for a more complex example.

segment.source: Formatting text
segment.target: Formatting text

segment.source: Although the RichTextBlock stores plain text, you can apply various formatting options to customize how the text is rendered in your app.
segment.target: Although the RichTextBlock stores plain text, you can apply various formatting options to customize how the text is rendered in your app.

segment.source: You can set standard control properties like FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, Foreground, and CharacterSpacing to change the look of the text.
segment.target: You can set standard control properties like FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, Foreground, and CharacterSpacing to change the look of the text.

segment.source: You can also use inline text elements and Typography attached properties to format your text.
segment.target: You can also use inline text elements and Typography attached properties to format your text.

segment.source: These options affect only how the RichTextBlock displays the text locally, so if you copy and paste the text into a rich text control, for example, no formatting is applied.
segment.target: These options affect only how the RichTextBlock displays the text locally, so if you copy and paste the text into a rich text control, for example, no formatting is applied.

segment.source: Inline elements
segment.target: Inline elements

segment.source: The Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents namespace provides a variety of inline text elements that you can use to format your text, such as Bold, Italic, Run, Span, and LineBreak.
segment.target: The Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents namespace provides a variety of inline text elements that you can use to format your text, such as Bold, Italic, Run, Span, and LineBreak.

segment.source: A typical way to apply formatting to sections of text is to place the text in a Run or Span element, and then set properties on that element.
segment.target: A typical way to apply formatting to sections of text is to place the text in a Run or Span element, and then set properties on that element.

segment.source: Here's a Paragraph with the first phrase shown in bold, blue, 16pt text.
segment.target: Here's a Paragraph with the first phrase shown in bold, blue, 16pt text.

segment.source: Typography
segment.target: Typography

segment.source: The attached properties of the Typography class provide access to a set of Microsoft OpenType typography properties.
segment.target: The attached properties of the Typography class provide access to a set of Microsoft OpenType typography properties.

segment.source: You can set these attached properties either on the RichTextBlock, or on individual inline text elements, as shown here.
segment.target: You can set these attached properties either on the RichTextBlock, or on individual inline text elements, as shown here.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: See Typography and Guidelines for fonts.
segment.target: See Typography and Guidelines for fonts.

segment.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
segment.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
segment.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
